A peaceful and spiritually uplifting place. Mangala Vihar Buddhist Temple offers a serene atmosphere that invites reflection and calm. Temple is beautifully maintained with traditional architecture and inspiring Buddhist teachings.

Whether youâ€™re here to meditate, pay respects, or simply enjoy the quiet ambiance. Highly recommended for anyone seeking tranquility and cultural richness.
The Theravada Buddhist temple, with a history of 65 years, provides Theravada Buddhist courses and meditation in Chinese and English, which are open to all races and ages.
A sacred temple just a short walk from Eunos MRT station. There is also a beautiful Buddha statue that is located in the backyard.

Mangala Vihara Buddhist Temple is indeed located in opposite of Eunos MRT at Jalan Eunos.  It is a well-known Theravada Buddhist temple in Singapore. There are many great wall arts inside Buddha house and feeling like in Sri Lankan traditional buddhist temple like Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya in Sri Lanka.

One of the oldest Theravada Buddhist temples in Singapore.

Daily puja in English. Also free classes on dharma and abhidharma on Sunday mornings from 10am to 11am. One hour per subject. Conducted in English and lesson materials (including high quality textbooks) are provided for free.  Teachers are volunteers. There are exams every year and it takes five years, I believe, to complete the course. There is also a diploma program.

Also, there are Buddhist chanting classes conducted every week.

In addition, there are free meditation classes (mindfulness - non religious) that are open to the public. And other classes such as yoga. Depending on the available of volunteers to lead the class. Most, if not all, of these classes are conducted in English.

Highly recommended.
